item.title: Liz add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Someone who thinks death is the scariest thing doesn't know a thing about life." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Liz add a quote by Hillary Rodham Clinton
item.description: "It took a Clinton to clean up after the first Bush, it may take another Clinton to clean up after the second one" -- Hillary Rodham Clinton

item.title: Liz add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "What is hardest to accept about the passage of time is that the people who once mattered the most to us wind up in parentheses." -- John Irving

item.title: Liz add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Nobody around here had ever seen a lady beekeeper till her. She liked to tell everybody that women made the best beekeepers, 'cause they have a special ability built into them to love creatures that sting. It comes from years of loving children and husbands." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Liz add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Liz add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Liz add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "The way of the miracle-worker is to see all human behavior as one two things: either love, or a call for love." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Liz add a quote by Terry Helwig
item.description: "Even if others abandon you, you must never abandon yourself." -- Terry Helwig

item.title: Liz add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "FEAR stands for fuck everything and run." -- Stephen King
